AND, they don’t contain any extraordinary ingredients – you can actually find the majority of ingredients can be found in CVS-Brand Moisturizers. This drove me nuts. I did research on all the ingredients and all of it is positive. I also now only use skin care that is organic ingredients . I have been using it for 1 month now, and this Vitamin Enhanced Face Firming Serum has already made m face tighter and firmer. It's called the Rainbow. It uses water to clean the air and the rest of my home. After I saw an in-home demonstration and compared it side-by-side with my Dyson. I immediately quit using the Dyson and bought the Rainbow. My home is cleaner, my air is cleaner, and my family and guests are no longer bothered by their allergies when they are here. Having several fur-shedding pets makes my Rainbow even more welcome in my home because it picks up all of the hair and pet dander! I haven't tried the Dyson, but the Miele is awesome. It's also so quiet that my cat doesn't even leave the room when I turn it on. Shocking. As for the LaMer, I use it, yes I do. But I do think the lotion is better than the creme, unless you have very very dry skin. I really really love the lotion. If you start feeling like $140 for lotion is too expensive, head to the La Prairie counter and price theirs. Yow. Anyway, I like the creme as an eye cream, and when you use it like that it's almost cheap because, um, it's giant for a jar of eye cream. Definitely ask for a sample - they will so give you one. I’m with Sara on the Miele vacuum. I haven’t tried the Dyson, but the Miele is awesome. It’s also so quiet that my cat doesn’t even leave the room when I turn it on. Shocking.

As for the LaMer, I use it, yes I do. But I do think the lotion is better than the creme, unless you have very very dry skin. I really really love the lotion. If you start feeling like $140 for lotion is too expensive, head to the La Prairie counter and price theirs. Yow. ]]> By: krista http://workitmom.com/bloggers/milkandcookies/2008/03/25/are-these-high-end-products-worth-the-hype/#comment-1631 krista Mon, 07 Apr 2008 15:00:06 +0000 http://workitmom.com/bloggers/milkandcookies/2008/03/25/are-these-high-end-products-worth-the-hype/#comment-1631 i finally tried LeMer face cream, gave it to myself as a gift...i'm good at that...as expected it is okay but not sensational. have not seen any miracles yet, but i'm only through half the jar. so still time i guess. the gel version of the product may be nicer, i bought the original one which you massage into your hands, then press onto your face. LeMer is actually NOT the most expensive face moisturizer out there, there are ones quite a bit higher. I'm glad i satisfied my curiosity, but probably would not buy it again. i did, however, get a sample of Natura Bisse glyco extreme peel, i would buy this!!! sample has lasted a long time & now peeks my interest in the rest of their product line. thanks!! i finally tried LeMer face cream, gave it to myself as a gift…i’m good at that…as expected it is okay but not sensational. have not seen any miracles yet, but i’m only through half the jar. so still time i guess. the gel version of the product may be nicer, i bought the original one which you massage into your hands, then press onto your face.
